message: Count me in. I have requested an invite. Nothing so far.
Does google give them out, or do beta users give them out?
If anyone has one, I'd love an invite.
@penkin Same here, I'm still waiting.
@doki_pen google is giving them to zoom users first then android phones so if you don't have any of these your stuck waiting and users can't send out invites
I was in the conf and asked one of the employees about it. she said, google will start distributing invitations soon
and I guess they haven't started yet
Thanks.  Patiently waiting for an invite for my Incredible :D
@azer Thanks for the heads up. I'll have to keep an eye on my email.
I'm not happy they only releasing beta in the u.s. :-(
Yes! Want!
@matthewfowles I wonder if it's to do with copyrights? Still think it's a stupid model. Seems to be a flaw that will forever follow movies, series and music.
searched throughout inside -- no way to invite anyone
I just got an invite -- using an Incredible
Is you DI rooted? Are you using SenseUI, or something else?  I wonder if using Cyanogen hurts my chances.
I received the invite yesterday. You cannot invite other people like other services.

@penkin yeh i agree definitely copyright google has similar problems with phones over here thats why we dont have voice! But as far as copyright and piracy goes we are closer to breaking the system than ever!
Can only upload music through PC or Mac, not even from android device.. ::sadface::
I guess I'll have to stick with Amazon Cloud for now.  You can upload music on linux via the Cloud Drive uploader.
Got an invite!
I wonder why they aren't supporting linux, usually they do.  I wonder if it's something to do with not pissing off RIAA.  I know they hate DRM free systems.

@doki_pen This is horribly disappointing since my main two computers are both running Linux. Also, I found it odd that you cannot upload music from the Amazon Cloud Player screen on Linux like you can on a PC or a Mac, but you can still upload it from the Amazon Cloud Drive page with Linux.
I don't mind if things don't work perfectly. We are a minority after all. But it stinks when there is no work-around.
@doki_pen I agree. I don't expect everything to work flawlessly coming right out of the gate on Linux. But not even being able to try with some things is frustrating.
@doki_pen I suppose then as an Ubuntu user it's useless to me then :( no urgency foot new to get an invite the.
Just requested an invite
I had the mine last week as I live in France. I'm able to use it on my Nexus S =)
@JohnFail Just play a VM to upload them =P
@OyoKooN Haha, that would work. I think I would just be lazy and stick with Amazon for the time being, though. Not that it matters since I still haven't received an invite.
